casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Cedric Theodis HOBBS, Jr. 263PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 28, 2019 John Keating Wiles, Attorney at Law, Raleigh. Amy Kunstling Irene, Special Deputy Attorney General, William R. West, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina. Sterling P. Rozear, Assistant Appellate Defender, Cedric Theodis Hobbs, Jr., for Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.) Donald H. Beskind, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality. David Weiss, Attorney at Law, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. James E. Coleman, Jr., Attorney at Law, Elizabeth Hambourger, Attorney at Law, Durham, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 28th of June 2019 by Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Quality for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 28th of June 2019."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
